intro: Anemone thalictroides var. uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered thalictroid anemone, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features delicate, white to pale yellow flowers with a distinctive, spurred petal at the base, typical of the Ranunculaceae family. The plant has palmately divided, trifoliate leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in moist, rich soils and partial to full shade, making it a suitable choice for woodland gardens. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a subtle yet elegant touch to the landscape.
